ETYMOLOGY: From pre- (before) and view, first attested in the early 20th century.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An advance showing of a film, play, exhibition, or product before its official release or opening.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We were invited to a special preview of the art exhibition before it opened to the public.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在向公众开放之前，我们被邀请参加了该艺术展览的特别预展。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To show or view something in advance of its public release or availability.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 预先观看；预先展示；试演
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The director decided to preview the documentary in three major cities.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 导演决定在三个主要城市预先放映这部纪录片。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In computing, to display how a document, web page, or graphic will look when finalized, printed, or published.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （计算机）预览（查看文档或网页的最终效果）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Always preview the design layout before clicking the publish button.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在点击发布按钮之前，一定要预览设计布局。

REGISTER: General usage, common in media, marketing, and computing contexts.
